Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work in Democratic Congo 
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- A seminar on "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism", a famous work of leader Kim Jong Il, and a lecture were held in Democratic Congo between May 13 and 15 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the start of his work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Kanga Ngerien Jerom, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, and other speakers explained the main content and significance of the work. And they referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has strengthened the WPK into the eternal party of President Kim Il Sung while wisely leading it to always emerge victorious with his outstanding political ability.    
 Kamwiziku Octave, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, in the lecture recalled that Kim Jong Il authored a large number of celebrated works to develop and enrich the immortal Juche idea and has achieved victory after victory with his original Songun politics. And he highly praised Kim Jong Il as a peerlessly brilliant commander and a great statesman.

Nigerian Party Delegation Winds Up Its Visit to Korea
articles.content:
Nigerian Party Delegation Winds Up Its Visit to Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria led by Deputy National Chairman Ibrahim S. Shema left for home after winding up its 4-day visit to the DPRK on Tuesday.
 It was seen off at the airport by Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and the Nigerian charge d'affaires ad interim here.    
 During its stay the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Party Founding Museum, the Korean Revolution Museum, the Pyongyang Metro and others and appreciated an acrobatic performance given by the Pyongyang Circus.

articles.title: DPRK and Brazil Sign Trade Agreement
articles.content:
DPRK and Brazil Sign Trade Agreement
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- An agreement on trade between the governments of the DPRK and Brazil was signed here on Tuesday.
 The agreement was inked by DPRK Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man and Brazilian Ambassador to the DPRK Luiz Augusto de Castro Neves.

Foreign Delegations Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Here
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- A forestry delegation of the Russian Federation led by Vice-Minister of Industry and Energy Ivan Matsyorov arrived here on Tuesday to participate in the 9th Meeting of the Forestry Sub-committee of the Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy and Science and Technology between the governments of the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
 Also arriving here today were Richard Stenberg, chairman of the Swedish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and a delegation of the Japanese Buddhist Circle with Raitei Arima, director general of the Kyoto Buddhist Society of Japan, as an honorary head and with Ryoko Nishioka, priest of Enman Temple and former executive secretary general of Tendai Religion, as head.

articles.title: Credentials of Brazilian Ambassador Received
articles.content:
Credentials of Brazilian Ambassador Received
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Brazilian Ambassador to the DPRK Luiz Augusto de Castro Neves at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam had a conversation with the ambassador.
